source.f7ee670d:
# Filtering required columns for Visualization
df_num1=df_num[['no_of_trainings','age','length_of_service','avg_training_score']]
df_num1.head()
source.3f040f2d:
# Scenario-1: Histogram for all numeric variables together(in one single plot)
df_num1.plot(kind="hist")
source.7460ba22:
# Scenario-2:To generate individual plots for variables
df_num1.hist(figsize=(8,6))
source.11bfa77f:
# Scenario-3:To generate a specific variable plot
df_num1.age.hist(figsize=(8,6))
source.982a97cc:
# Scenario-5:Categorical variable wise Histogram
df_cate_num=df[['gender','age']]
df_cate_num.head()
source.fe17c77d:
# Scenario-1: Box plot for all numerica variables
df_num1.boxplot(figsize=(8,6))
source.bd8e862e:
# Scenario-2: Box plot for required variable
df_num1.boxplot(column=['length_of_service'])
source.2ce2f411:
# Scenario-3: Box plot for grouping variable wise
df.boxplot(column=['age'], by='department',figsize=(12,6))
source.abf0ce25:
# Scenario-1: simple bar chart with categorical and frequency columns
df.plot.bar(x='Tyee_of_accounts',y='Aug_avg_acct',figsize=(8,5))
source.0025ca22:
# Scenario-2: Bar chart with categorical and Multiple Numeric columns
df.plot.bar(x='Tyee_of_accounts',figsize=(8,6))
source.922c98f6:
# Scenario-3: Bar chart stacked option with categorical and Multiple Numeric columns 
df.plot.bar(x='Tyee_of_accounts',figsize=(8,6),stacked=True)
source.3852d886:
# Scenario-4: Horizontal bar chart stacked option with categorical and Multiple Numeric columns 
df.plot.barh(x='Tyee_of_accounts',figsize=(8,6),stacked=True)
source.ca1da6b0:
It is plot for continuous data.

It generate frequency distribution. Frequency data plot.

It used for outlier analysis, skewness identification & distribution identification.

Bin-range of the data ex: values :(23,24,27,29,30) Bin: 20-30 frequency: 5

Bins need to adjust depends on data.

![image.png](attachment:8c7b859b-bb17-4a64-a522-8b491ebbd772.png)
source.20b85964:
It’s called box and whisker plot

It display data distribution in terms of quartiles.

It use for outlier analysis, skewness analysis and comparison analysis.

It use for qualitative & quantitative data.

![image.png](attachment:c3fe977a-d623-43e0-819f-6244b3e25689.png)
source.e11dd3e0: Bins: Default it show 10 bins, if you want to increase use "bin" option
source.af00b588:
It’s represents categorical data(ordinal/nominal)

It’s use for Uni-variate, Bi-variate analysis & Multi-variate analysis

Stacked bar graph is good for Bi-variate & Multi-variate analysis
